title.narrative: Kailahun Agricultural and Livelihood Support Project (KALiSP)

description.narrative: Placement of animals, training in Cornerstones, Leadership, Crop and Livestock Integration, Animal Wellbeing, Provision of seeds (Rice & Groundnut), Veterinary Support, Exchange Visits, Sensitization HIV/AIDs, Water and Sanitation and the Environment, influencing policies, systems and practices

The objectives of the Kailahun Agricultural and Livelihood Support Project (KALiSP) are to increase food production, generate supplementary income, increase knowledge and skills of beneficiaries in livestock and crop production, enhance leadership and decision making and sensitize beneficiaries on issues relating to HIV/AIDs, Water and Sanitation and the environment. KALiSP will be implemented in 12 community groups in five chiefdoms in Kailahun District, Eastern Province of Sierra Leone. These are: Njaluahun, Jawei, Upper Bambara, Luawa and Kissi Kama chiefdoms. The project will be implemented for a period of five years and will benefit a total of 1,200 farm families during the period. The main components of the project will include: Rearing of small ruminants: goats and sheep • Promotion of food security through cultivation of rice and groundnut • Training of beneficiaries in project management, animal husbandry and crop production • Sensitization on environmental issues, HIV/AIDs and Water and Sanitation • Influencing systems, policies and practices that affect their livelihoods through advocacy
